Products and Services


 

 

 

 

Objectives

This module is an introduction. By the end of the module, you will be able to:

  • Define our networking society
  • Identify the key terms used in the Cell C Products and Services world
  • Identify the importance of product research
  • List the product values
  • Identify the product focus

Our Changing World

The customer’s world is changing and we are now part of a networked society. From social networks to business websites, a growing part of our personal and business lives now has a digital face. 




What are the Key Terms

Used in the Cell C Products and Services world

Products that are paid for upfront. Customers can TopUp as they need. Cell C customers gain lifetime access to the Cell C network when recharging every 120 days.
Cell C has built a highly advanced 2G, 3G, HSPA+ IP network. Cell C's own network covers 97% of the population. Coverage for 3G is at approximately 79% of the population. With the inclusion of our roaming agreement the company provides national coverage of over 98% of the population to its more than 10 million subscribers.
Customers sign a fixed contract option where they first use our services and are billed at the end of each cycle. Cell C offers Voice and Data contracts. Contract durations are: 1 month; 6 months; 12 months , 18 months & 24 months

Product Development in Cell C

Product development is a complex process that requires input from many stakeholders.

Extensive research is needed to establish specific product features and benefits best suited to the different customer segments.

Product development is based on the market trends and the customer’s lifestyle needs.

Product Development in Cell C

Protect the Cell C Brand - we don't want to create wrong brand associations. The aim should be to provide good and believable deals, VALUE FOR MONEY - rather than giving away too much
Lead the market with the best guaranteed rate for voice across all channels. Introduced the most affordable flat rate for DATA. Disrupt the market with international calling prices. Transparent and simple offers. Call anyone on any local network anytime at the same rate.
Reduced restrictions also offer a business benefit to Cell C in reducing secondary / multiple SIM use i.e. encourages the customers to keep the SIM in rather than only using it to take advantage of certain benefits (e.g. ON-NET calling only or weekend calling)

Legislation and Regulatory Bodies


Objectives

By the end of this chapter, you should be able to:

  • Identify the governing body that influences the telecommunication industry in South Africa
  • Identify the regulatory bodies that influence the telecommunication industry in South Africa
  • Understand what RICA is able to do
  • Define what RICA means for the customer and Cell C

Telecommunications Governing Bodies

 

The Independent Communications Authority of South Africa

 

ICASA dictates industry rules and business operations in areas such as fees and charges, accounts and recordkeeping, anti-competitive practices (like advertising), rules for company mergers, and the right of government to monitor and intercept communications.


Regulatory Bodies within South Africa

 


RICA 

(Regulation of Interception Communication Act)

RICA is able to distinguish between:

  • Direct communication
  • Indirect communication

Direct communication between two people (spoken conversations)

 

Indirect communication (transferring data i.e. texts, files, images, signals, voice messages)

 


The RICA Rules

RICA allows for the lawful interception of various communications, both direct and indirect:

  • Rule 1
  • Rule 2
  • Rule 3
  • Rule 4
  • Rule 5

The Consumer Protection Act  

 

What is the role of the CPA?

 

It promotes and advances the social and economic welfare of consumers in South Africa by creating a legal framework for the establishment of a fair, efficient, accessible and sustainable consumer market. This means the consumer is protected against entering into any unfair and one-sided transaction; or any business activity that directly or indirectly has or is likely to have the effect of deceiving the consumers; or changing any agreements unilaterally that will unfairly affect any consumer.


Policies that allow CPA Compliance

EasyChat

EasyChat is a default tariff plan, with the following features:

  • Pay R1.50 per minute TO ANY NETWORK AT ANY TIME
  • Calls charged per second
  • Use data at 79c per MB
  • Send SMS / MMS at 50c

It is a super basic, easy and very convenient product. No fuss!!


EpicBundles

EpicBundles are only available to EasyChat prepaid customers. See what this includes:

 

  • Dial *105# to buy an EPIC bundle.

  • Customers will forfeit any remaining minutes once the minutes have expired.

  • The inclusive value for the minute bundles cannot be consumed for any off-net voice usage, any premium rated usage, content purchases, VAS/Data bundle purchases, international call/SMS or any form of roaming usage.


EPIC Bundles – Daily Minute Bundle

Only 1 (one) bundle can be purchase at a time and only 1 (one) bundle may be active at any given time. Bundles purchased on the day can only be used on that day - no carryover of minutes is allowed.

Look at the table below and see what the customer gets!


EasyChat and EPIC Bundles

Customers may purchase an EPIC weekend bundle at any time during the week; however the airtime can only be used between 00:00:01 on Saturday and 23:59:59 on Sunday of the forthcoming weekend. If the bundle is purchased on the weekend, then usage of the airtime is only valid for the same weekend. Customers will receive R100 airtime value for R20 that can be used for Cell © to Cell © voice calls, SMS and Data.

The airtime value will deplete at:

1.99 per Cell C to Cell C voicecall.
R1.99 per MB for Data.
R0.50 for local SMS's.

Sharks Mobile

Sharks Mobile is a Prepaid tariff plan targeted at medium to high value Sharks fans as well as the broader mobile consumer.

The offer includes a branded starter pack, free content, free minutes on game days and double the recharge value back in bonus airtime.

  • If customers recharges with R10 or more on a game day, they get 80 FREE Cell © to Cell © minutes, valid from 6am to 6pm
  • Customers will receive video clips of coaching and lifestyle tips from the players of the Sharks Rugby team, via SMS, for Free

66 Cents for Real

The 66c tariff plan that offers a very low voice call rate of just R0.66 per minute – to any network, anytime.

  • Out-of-bundle Data rate of R2.00 per MB will apply (load a data bundle and benefit from 15c per MB).
  • This tariff plan is only available to Prepaid customers (new and existing).
  • This plan is also a Per Second billing plan, and customers pay 1,1 cents a second.

 

This is awesome because:

Even though customers will only receive the face value of the recharge value upon recharging and NO SUPACHARGE or MegaBonus benefits, they will benefit from a very competitive call rate of 66 cents per minute.


How to change to 66 Cents for Real

 

Simply dial *147# and under option 1 ”Tariff Change” you will be able to migrate your tariff plan.

 

Or

 

Dial 141 and choose Option 3 “Change Tariff Plan”.

 

Remember:

The first migration in the month is FREE and thereafter customers are charged at R5 per migration.

On successful migration the customer will receive an SMS.

 Customers must purchase the Infinity Prepaid Voucher and recharge their account by dialling *102*recharge pin#. 

 


Infinity Vouchers Offers:

  • Voice

SmartData Deals

SmartData Deals allows customer to buy data that doesn’t expire for a year. The options for how much data they buy includes 1,2GB, 2,4GB, 3GB, 6GB, 12GB, 24GB, 60GB

 

Rules that apply to SmartData Deals Prepaid:

 

1. Activation and Validity

  • Pay up-front for 12 months of data
  • No new SIM purchase necessary. Load bundles onto existing SIM
  • Package option: pay for data upfront and receive data valid for 365 days

 

2. Usages and balances

  • Unused data does not carry over to next year

GIGA 100 and GIGA 200 

What do you get with each of the deals:

 

 


Rules that Apply to Giga 100 and 200 Deals

  • 1. Activation and Validity
  • 2. Usage and balances
  • 3. Support
  • 4. Notifications

Activation and Validity

  • Customers can only use the SIM for data on the Cell © network and for voice, SMS,
    MMS on any other network
  • The entire allocation of 100GB is available upon activation
  • Recharge will not extend the airtime window
  • 365 airtime window
  • No roll-over on unused data
  • SIM defaults to 99©ents for Real Tariff Plan
  • Vodacom data roaming not allowed
  • With the GIGA 200, No migrations for 12 months possible.

 

 

2. Usage and balances

  • No international roaming (on any Prepaid package) 
  • Can load data bundles
  • Loyalty, free or bonus data is depleted first
  • Out of bundle usage charged at 15c/MB 

3. Support

  • Dial *101# for summary balances Dial *147# for detailed balances 141 IVR
 

4. Notifications

  • Activation SMS confirming their MSISDN
  • RICA and Welcome SMS
  • SMS will be sent when a customer has 20GB, 10GB and 5GB left of their bundle
  • SMS alert will be sent 30 days before the 1 year expiry date is reached on the 100GB bundle, and 72 hours before on the 200GB. Only if the customer has a balance of their bundle remaining • SMS confirming when the data bundles are loaded

DailyData Bundle

Cell ©'s DailyData bundles now make it possible to browse the internet and social media platforms even when times are tough. The bundles only expire at midnight on the day of purchase, so even after the sun has gone down you can continue to surf the net.

NiteData Bundle

If you're a night owl and want to download music and videos, browse the web or chat to friends after the clock has struck 12, Cell ©'s NiteData bundles open up a world of possibility between 1am and 7am. With unbelievably low rates.

Defining Post-Paid Products

 

Post-Paid products offer customers a fixed contract option where they first use our services and are billed at the end of each cycle. Cell © offers a fast range of Postpaid products for customers to select from.

 

 

Take Note: We like BlackBerry, so we treat them differently – we will look at Postpaid Blackberry products a bit later.


Changing Our Legacy 

The churn rate (customers leaving the network) amongst Prepaid customers is much higher than amongst a Postpaid customer base.

 

You can help stop people leaving Cell © and moving to other providers. Your role is to sign customers up on the right deals. If the customer feels their deal has value to them, they will stay!


ChatMore

ChatMore is a postpaid contract with a 79c flat rate (to any network, anytime) on pure per second billing. There are two ChatMore options, Standard and 200 or 400.  Click the buttons to discover what they are:

ChatMore Standard - customers will not receive inclusive minutes or data, simply pay as you use per month
ChatMore 200 - customers will receive 200 any-net minutes as well as 150MB of free data, for only R159 per month
ChatMore 400 - customers will receive 400 any-net minutes as well as 300MB of free data, for only R319 per month

ChatMore includes:

  • The SIM Only contracts are available on a month-to-month offer (experience the most competitive Postpaid rates in the market)
  • 30 day notice period
  • Deals with handsets on 24 month contracts
  • Out of bundle rates of 79c flat rate

ChatMore doesn’t include:

  •  Any SMS’s
  • Included benefits are not carried over
  • Unused benefits are forfeited at the end of the month

Credit Vetting with ChatMore: 

  • On ChatMore Standard credit vetting will take place via a credit card only.
  • The cards must say ‘Credit Card’
  • The card should be validated as Credit and not Cheque
  • Initials and surname if card is embossed
  • The credit card must still be valid – validate expiry date on card
  • Must be a VISA, Master, American Express or a Diners Club card

 


ChatMore Standard Tariff Plan

Out of Bundle Tariffs on ChatMore are only 79c!


ChatMore 200 Tariff Plan

Out of Bundle Tariffs on ChatMore are only 79c!


ChatMore 400 Tariff Plan

Out of Bundle Tariffs on ChatMore are only 79c!


SmartChat

This product includes: 

  • A combination of anytime Data, NITE Data (12am to 6am) as well as inclusive any-net minutes.
  • SmartChat is only available to Postpaid and TopUp customers.
  • The product is available to consumer and business customers who prefer a contract package that offers more data at affordable rates.
  • SmartChat SIM ONLY deals will be available as month-to-month and variable contracts: 6, 12, 18 and 24 months.
  • The Contract deal (SIM + Handset) will be available as a 24 months contract only.

SmartChat Plans

Customers can choose from 5 different plans:

SmartChat 1GB

SmartChat 2GB

SmartChat 3GB

SmartChat 6GB

SmartChat 8GB


SmartChat Business Rules

The first month’s allocation of data and inclusive minutes will be pro-rated dependent on the date of activation on the selected SmartChat package, thereafter customers will receive the inclusive benefits on the first of the new month.

SmartChat inclusive benefits not used in the month shall be forfeited on the last day of that current month. After 30 days all remaining inclusive benefits will expire, i.e. benefits will not be carried over. 

Inclusive benefits will be credited monthly, on the 1st day of the month for the duration of the contract.

Infinity Select

This product offers Postpaid Customers access to unlimited calling to anyone on any network, any time of day, inclusive unlimited SMSs and 3GB free Data on a SIM ONLY package.

 

The Infinity Select product includes a 12 month handset upgrade and a replacement handset should the customer’s handset get damaged during the 24 month contract period. The product offering can be activated at any of the Postpaid participating Cell © stores.


The features of Infinity Select

Unlimited Voice Calls to any Network

  • Upon activation, customers can make unlimited voice calls to anyone on any local Network at any time of day.
  • Unlimited Voice Call does not apply to international calls, international roaming calls and premium rated voice. These are at out- of-bundle usage and added to the bill at the end of the month.

SMS (Infinity Select Inclusive SMSs) 

  • Unlimited SMS's to local networks.
  • International SMS's and Premium rated SMS's are excluded and charged at the end of the month
  • All SMS's not used within the month are forfeited

Data (Infinity Select Inclusive Data) 

  • The 3GB FREE inclusive Data is immediately available.
  • On depletion of the FREE Data, the standard out-of-bundle data rate applies

Infinity Select Tariff Plan


Infinity Select

Look at the rules that apply to this product

 

1. Usages and Balances 

 

The unlimited calls are only valid for the calendar month.
On the 1st of the new month, all inclusive benefits are credited to the Customer account for usage in that month.
The Infinity Select product inclusive benefits are valid for a calendar month. There shall be no carry-over of any unused benefits. The first month inclusive benefits will be valid for the pro-rated period where applicable.
All inclusive benefits will expire at midnight on the last day of the month and the new inclusive benefits shall be credited on the first of every month.

EPIC Packages

The EPIC Contract plans offer inclusive Rand Value benefits to use as you choose for Calls, SMS and Data

  • You get 30% additional value on the EPIC plans
  • Rand value in the form of airtime to be used for Voice, Data or SMS as per the tariff plan depletion rates
  • The allocated Rand value cannot be used to purchase data bundles
  • There is no carryover of the unused value. The unused value will be forfeited
  • Use WhatsApp for FREE
  • The EPIC packages are available on both Postpaid and Top Up for new and existing customer Options include: Epic 100, 150, 200, 350, 500, 650 and 1000 (the rand value is equal to the amount in the package name)

Meet Devon

Devon is working for a law firm, he is their driver and he makes deliveries for the many lawyers. His company and position require him to be available on his cell phone at all times of the day. He makes a lot of calls to clients and colleagues and he sends a lot of SMS’s for work. He also emails a lot. In his free time, he chats to his friends on Watsapp and the Facebook chat app, Messenger and he uses the Google Map app all day. His bill is often over R1500 a month, he wants to move to Cell C and get a better deal, but he has a new smartphone and doesn’t need a new one. He also doesn’t know how long he will be with his company, if he leaves he will need to cancel the contract because he will not be able to pay it.

What do you think Devon’s priority is?

  1. Devon wants to be able to make any number of calls
  2. He wants to be able to cancel his contract if he needs to

Hi5 Packages

Hi5 is a product that provides Families, Friends, SME’s and Customers with preferential rates to 5 numbers.

  • Inclusive minutes to be used to call any network, inclusive SMSs and inclusive Data. The product will be launched with an exclusive handset offer over a limit period of time.

 


Hi5 Package: What Business Rules apply? 

  • Activations
  • Usage and Balances

 

Activations

  • The Cell © Hi5 customers must complete a new Cell © agreement.
  • Activation is subject to standard Cell © Postpaid RICA and credit vetting rules.
  • The first month’s allocation of Data will be pro-rated dependent on the date of activation.
  • On activation, the customer on Cell © Hi5 will receive 150MB of Data, 150 Any Net calls, 150 SMSs.
  • Customers will also have the option of adding 5 Friends and Family. 

Usage and Balances

  • 150 Voice minutes to any local network.
  • 150 SMSs to any local network.
  • 150 MB Data.
  • Option to add 5 Friends and Family and call each other.
  • Included benefits will automatically be carried over for a maximum of 90 (ninety) days if not used in the current calendar month.

  • You can only add 5 Cell C numbers to your Friends and Family.

Vitality Mobile

Vitality Mobile is a StraightUp or StraightUp TopUp contract with an optional Smart Data contract. Vitality Mobile is exclusively available to all active Vitality and KeyFIT members.

 

  • Free calls* to other Vitality Mobile customers

  • An extra 50% data boost (with a minimum of 100MB)

  • And the monthly service fee is only R29


How to Purchase Vitality Mobile

  • Purchasing Vitality Mobile
  • Migrating onto Vitality Mobile
  • Understanding the products

 

     Purchasing VitalityMobile

  • Available through a dedicated Direct Call Centre 084 157 0000.
  • Product information, activation of a new line (including porting), activation of additional lines are done via this call centre.
  • Vitality Mobile queries are routed to 084 140.

     Migrating onto Vitality Mobile

  • Customers due for upgrade can migrate to Vitality Mobile
  • Free Vitality Mobile calls are subject to a fair-usage policy of up to 480 free minutes a month

    Understanding the products 

  • Vitality Mobile works in exactly the same way as our current StraightUp TopUp and Smartdata offers. On StraightUp customers can choose: 
  • A Vitality Mobile package from StraightUp or StraightUp TopUp 100 and above
  • Their contract term/duration
  • Their device (optional)

SmartData for Post-Paid

This data package can be bought on a contract, at a length of 12 or 24 months available. Customers must know that unused MB does not carry over to the next month. Customers can choose from the following packages (2GB is only 24 month contracts can choose this package):


GIGA 200 for Post-Paid

Rules that apply:

Activation and validity

  • The entire allocation of 20GB is available upon activation
  • Recharge will not extend the airtime window
  • No roll-over on unused data
  • SIM defaults to 99 ©ents for Real Tariff Plan
  • Vodacom data roaming not allowed
  • No migrations for 12 months possible

Usage and Balances

  • International roaming is possible on Postpaid Giga 200 but the peak and midnight bundles are not available when roaming
  • Data usage for international roaming will be billed separately at the applicable rate of the roaming (this is out-of-bundle usage)
  • Out of bundle usage charged at 15c/MB
  • All out-of-bundle usage will always be billed in arrears
  • Peak is 06:00:00 and 23:59:59
  • Midnight is between 00:00:00 and 05:50:59
  • Voice, SMS, MMS usage is allowed on the package- this is out of bundle usage and customer will be billed at the end of the month • Any free, loyalty or bonus data will be depleted first.

GIGA 200 for Post-Paid

Rules that apply:

Support

  • Dial *101# for summary balances
  • Dial *147# for detailed balances
  • Self-service (www.cellc.co.za)
  • SMS 14302 (SMS/IVR)

 

 

TopUp Usage

  • Customers must have airtime loaded on their account for out-of-bundle usage
  • All out of bundle usage will be deducted from airtime
  • All local midnight data usage that is on the Cell © network only while in South Africa will be deducted from the midnight data bundle first, while there is a balance available
  • If there is no balance of either peak or midnight data remaining: All usage is treated as out-of-bundle and charged to the customer’s bill at the end of the current calendar month
  • Customers can add a recurring anytime data bundle to their package

GIGA 200 for Post-Paid

Rules that apply:

Notifications

  • Activation SMS confirming their MSISDN
  • RICA and Welcome SMS
  • SMS confirming that their initial peak and midnight data bundles have been loaded
  • SMS confirming when the subsequent peak and midnight data bundles are loaded
  • SMS alert will be sent when customers reach limits during the course of the month on their peak and midnight data bundles
  • An SMS will also be sent when the customer has fully depleted their peak or midnight data bundle 

GigaNITE

Have a look at what the GigaNITE package is:

  • Only compatible with SmartData Postpaid products
  • Cannot purchase GigaNITE 10 or 20 as a standalone product
  • Cannot add this to a Postpaid/TopUp voice contract
  • Either 10GB or 20GB of off-peak Data
  • Off-peak is defined as usage between 00:00 and 06:00 daily
  • National roaming is allowed (i.e. usage on Vodacom)
  • Once the off-peak data is consumed additional usage will be:
  • Deducted from the main bundle on the account (if there is balance remaining)
  • Will be added to the customer’s bill (at 15c/MB) if there is no balance remaining
  • TheGigaNITE 10 and 20 bundle is loaded in addition to the “anytime” Data bundle on the customer’s package
  • Potential customers must meet the Credit Vetting requirements of the specific package (i.e. the cost of the standard package + the cost of the additional off-peak bundle)

GigaNite

The rules that apply to GigaNITE

  • Activation
  • Usage
  • Support
 

Activation

  • The GigaNITE 10 and 20 Data bundle must be added to the package via CRM (or node-to- node in the case of XSP)
  • The first GigaNITE 10 and 20 off-peak Data bundle will be loaded as soon as the bundle activation is completed
  • The first month the GigaNITE 10 and 20 Data bundle subscription and DATA volume will be pro-rated
  • Cell ©’s standard pro-rating rules for the first month’s Data allocation and subscription fees will apply
 

Usage

  • All local off-peak Data usage will be deducted from the GigaNITE 10 and 20 Data bundle first
  • Once the GigaNITE 10 and 20 Data bundle is depleted, usage during the off-peak period will deplete from the “primary” bundle – if there is balance remaining
  • If there is no balance remaining on the “primary” bundle, usage will be billed to at the standard out-of-bundle rate of R0.15/MB
  • All out-of-bundle usage will be billed at the end of the month
  • The GigaNITE 10 and 20 Data bundle is not available when roaming
  • Data usage for international roaming will be billed separately (at the applicable rate of the roaming partner – this is out-of-bundle usage)
  • Standard Data roaming business rules apply
  • Out of bundle (OOB) usage is charged at R0.15/MB
  • The balance of the GigaNITE 10 and 20 Data bundle will appear on the customers CRM profile
 

Support

Customers can check their GigaNITE 10 and 20 Data bundle balance by: •

  • Dialling *101#
  • Dialling *147#
  • Using the “balance” service on the “Account” tab of the Cell © Connector interface
  • Self-Service (www.cellc.co.za)
  • Via 14302 (SMS/IVR)
  • Through the Cell © Call Centre

Understanding the TopUp Products

What do you notice about these products?

You have seen all the names before, when we looked at Postpaid products. That’s because they are the same! The difference is that they can be added once the customer has exhausted their Postpaid benefits!! Sort of like a refill!!

 

A TopUp option is always a good cross-selling opportunity because it’s easy for us to sell the value it adds in terms of customer lifestyle and communication needs.


 

Blackberry

 


Objectives

Blackberry VAS

  

Any Cell © customer who owns or acquires a BlackBerry cellphone (in addition to other Value Added Services) will have access to four BlackBerry services: 

"BlackBerry Internet Service (BIS)"
"BlackBerry Enterprise Server (BES)"
"BlackBerry Social and Email service (BSE)"
"BlackBerry Social Service (BSS)"

Benefits of each BlackBerry VAS

Blackberry Social Service (BSE)

  • Access or browse the internet
  • Access to Social Networking Services (Facebook, Twitter)
  • Access to BlackBerry Messaging Services (BBM)
  • BlackBerry Mail (xxx@cellc.BlackBerry.com)

Blackberry Social and Email service (BSE)

  • Access or browse the internet
  • Access to Social Networking Services (Facebook, Twitter) 
  • Access to BlackBerry Messaging Services (BBM)
  • BlackBerry Mail (xxx@cellc.BlackBerry.com)
  • AND One web-based email account (e.g. yahoo/gmail)

Blackberry Internet Service (BIS)

  • Gives BlackBerry access to the internet. It’s like an ISP, but for a smartphone instead of a home computer.
  • Access to Social Networking Services (Facebook, Twitter)
  • Every time the customer’s BlackBerry gets an email, or accesses a web page it does so through BIS.
  • BlackBerry Mail (xxx@cellc.BlackBerry.com)

Blackberry Enterprise Server (BES)

  • Gives the customer’s BlackBerry access to a corporate intranet (the intranet is the private, internal, network within a company).
  • Access to Social Networking Services (Facebook, Twitter)
  • Many intranets allow one to communicate with the Internet as well, but with added layers of security.
  • The company must have a BES server for this benefit to work.
  • BlackBerry Mail (xxx@cellc.BlackBerry.com)

Activating Blackberry VAS's on Cell C

How to activate a Cell C BlackBerry 10 service plan

There are various ways you can activate a Cell C BlackBerry® 10 service plan:

  • Dial *147# from your BlackBerry® 10 handset and follow the screen prompts
  • Call Cell C customer care on 140
  • Visit a Cell C store near you. Find all Cell C Stores here

Please note that only one Cell C BlackBerry® 10 service plan can be active or activated on a single Cell C number.

Once a Cell C BlackBerry® 10 service plan has been successfully activated, you will be notified via SMS.

You can only deactivate a service plan by calling the Cell C Customer care centre on 140 or visiting a Cell C store near you.

SMS Bundles for TopUp

One of the Value Added Services includes SMS Bundles, which can be bought in addition to the SMS’s that a customer gets with their standard package. They can choose to top up with 25, 50, 100, 200, 300, 500, 1000, or 2000 SMS's a month.

Unused SMS will not roll over to the next month.
International SMS's don't apply to the SMS bundles, they will be billed separately at the normal international SMS rate .
Competition SMS's and premium SMS's are also excluded from the SMS bundle and will be billed separately at the advised rate.

C-Surance 

Fully comprehensive cellphone insurance product, underwritten by Hollard Insurance Company Limited. This product is available to all Postpaid and TopUp customers and can be added at any stage of a customers contract period.


Conditions for C-Surance

Steps that must be followed by the customer:

  1. Lodge a claim within 30 days of the date of 'event'
  2. Contact the administrator on 084 157 0007. Request a claim form
  3. Complete and fax/email the claim to the administrator

 


Conditions for C-Surance

 

Theft/loss

  • Blacklist the phone through Cell © Customer Care centre on 140 or 084 140
  • Report incident to SAPS using Cell © reference number
  • Call administrator on 084 157 0007 to report claim and obtain claim form
  • Complete claim form together with supporting documents. Submit to administrator via fax 086 297 88 17 or email cellc@finrite.co.za

Accidental damage

  • Call administrator on 084 157 0007 to report claim and obtain claim form
  • Complete claim form together with supporting documents.
  • Submit to administrator via fax 086 297 88 17 or email cellc@finrite.co.za 
  • Take the handset to the nearest Cell © store or service center for processing.

 

The Consultants Role

Store and Customer Care Consultants are only able to explain the benefits of C-Surance and are NOT ALLOWED to offer any insurance advice .

All support regarding C-Surance, including: sales, applications and claims are done via administrators’ call centre 084 157 0007 (free from Cell © phone).


C-Surance Excess Rules

The excess payable is determined by whether it is a loss/theft or a repair. Excess should be deposited into the administrator’s bank account before the claim is processed.


Emergency Airtime

This product allows prepaid customers to buy data on credit, if they need it in an emergency. They buy the data but pay for it later. It is sort of like a loan.

Some rules apply:

They must have been with Cell C for at least 6 months to be able to apply. They must also have been buying at least R30 worth of airtime in the past. If the customer has used the emergency airtime service in the past, they cannot use it again unless they have paid it back. When a customer recharges, any outstanding emergency airtime and service fee will be settled immediately (that is deducted first). Any remaining airtime will be made available on the customer’s airtime balance.

 

Customers can buy emergency airtime data at the Self Help code 147*7# and will be charges R1 service fee. They can buy the following amounts: R5, R10, R25, R50, R100.


Summary of How Emergency Airtime Works

Frequently Asked Emergency Airtime Questions


What is Airtime Share and why is it a great Value Add?

The new Airtime Share Service enables new and existing Cell © Prepaid and TopUp customers the ability to conveniently send airtime to other Cell © Prepaid or TopUp customers’ accounts via their cellphone, without the need for a recharge voucher, free of charge, anywhere and anytime.

 

The service is free of any charges and the amount is simply deducted form the sender’s available airtime balance and added to the receivers balance.


Airtime Share Case Study

Mary and Cindy are making plans to meet up later this evening. Mary send Cindy a message to ask what time they should meet. Cindy replied with a Please call ME. Mary calls Cindy and suggests 6pm. They end the call. 15 minutes later Cindy sends another Please Call ME. Mary calls her again and Cindy asks her what restaurant they should meet at. Mary suggests Nandos. They end the call. 20 Minutes later, Mary SMS’s Cindy and asks her what she is planning on wearing. Cindy replies with another Please Call Me. Mary calls her, and before she asks about Cindy’s wardrobe choices she asks why Cindy isn’t SMSing her or calling her back!! Cindy sheepishly admits that she forgot to buy airtime.

 

Two minutes later, Cindy gets a n SMS informing her that Mary has Shared R30 Airtime with her. They are able to continue making plans for the evening over SMS.

GetMore

GetMore provides customers with exclusive deals, discounted services and professional advice that just make life better.

 

The benefits are divided into 8 categories:

  • Play
  • Go
  • Ask Once
  • Shop
  • Home
  • Help
  • Drive
  • Money

PLAY

GO

Ask Once 

SHOP

HOME

HELP

DRIVE

MONEY


Remember the following about GetMore

Cell © GetMore is only for Cell © contract holders at a rate of R39 per month added to your Cell © bill.

 

Calls made from a Cell © handset are free. Calls made from any other network or Telkom line are charged at normal rates.

 

SMS’s will be charged at R1.50.


 

Itemised Billing

 

Itemised Billing is a service that outlines the customer's monthly spend on their existing contract

 

It is an optional service for Postpaid and TopUp customers – customers must opt-in for the service to be activated on their existing contract.

The Cell © Itemised billing monthly fee is R21.50. All new Postpaid and TopUp customers that opt-in for Itemised Billing will be charged at the applicable rate of R21.50.

Existing customers that are receiving the service but are not charged, i.e. zero-rated subscriptions, will only be charged for the service upon upgrading their existing contract or once their contract expires.

Retired Products

Some products are no longer sold, but we do need to know about them, so that we can help a customer who is still using one of the retired products. Let’s identify the ones that you might still encounter.


Red Bull Mobile Products

 Red Bull MOBILE on TopUp:

 

This product allowed you the flexibility to have a contract but to decide upfront how much you wanted to spend each month. Red Bull MOBILE existed to bring the thrilling and action-packed World of Red Bull to the customer via their mobile device, competitive tariff plans and great smartphones.

RBM Online 3GB:

 

3GB per month for 24 months, with a E367 USB Speed Stick capable of 21.6 Mbps . This package allowed customers to be credited with their data, airtime and SMSs on the 15th of every month, with TopUp billed on the first of each month. The Usages and Recharges were treated the same as with a TopUp package.

RBM Online 6GB:

 

RBM Data-enabled SIM with 6GB data allocation on Prepaid SIM for 365 days, and an E367 USB Speed Stick of 21.6 Mbps. This product has Defaulted to EasyChat all-day tariff rules

Why our Role is Important

The race for market dominance is on and we are in it to win! Formula 1 is not only about the speed and the number of sales we close; it is also about the endurance factor of the race.


Make it #EPIC

This means we are on our quest to ‘Make It #EPIC’ in the consumer market, across all segments, to achieve a perfect balance between:

Efficiency in process with effectiveness in team dynamics.
Cut throat adaptability with stability in core values and a strong, positive performance culture with the challenges posed by compliance and risk management. Cell C needs to be a reliable, strategic enabler for its existing customers but also be able to compete in a new territory (be racy, fast and agile) to build dominant footprint across all market segments.
An aggressive sales strategy with customer engagements.
